result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Antoine Payne was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael Antoine Payne is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Michael Antoine Payne was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Michael Antoine Payne was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation today June 13, 2016.
Bond continues until Defendant reports to Probation.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Antoine Payne

records.addlTxt:
DE called back stating SDC told him they can't collect his atty fees & his debt was rejected. DE was advised that we have not rec'd any notice that his debt was rejected by SDC & that I don't believe that atty fees are uncollectible. Clerk advised DE that I would contact SDC to clarify. jaf
Per SDC's supervising agent, the DE has not contacted them using his debt ID or SSN re: his debt & if he did contact them, general inquiries could only be made. SDC also confirmed that his debt is active w/them, atty fees are collectible & their agents cannot determine or have access to specific codes. jaf
Clerk spoke w/DE & relayed the info to him after speaking to SDC. DE was given SDC's phone # again. DE became upset & stated he doesn't understand why we turned the debt over as he had been making pymts. DE was reminded again that he failed to comply w/his PPA, so we elected to have another agency collect it. DE stated he would just file for bankruptcy. DE was encouraged to contact SDC to set up the Pymt Plan. Includes 15CM559, 18CF383.  jaf

DE called to request his pymt due date.  DE was advised that his debts have been turned over to SDC & he may set up a Pymt Plan w/them. DE stated he was making pymts, but was advised that he was making pymts up to 20 days late & this is why he was turned over. DE was given the ph # to contact SDC & advised that if they deem his debt uncollectible, we will take the debt back & issue a WA. DE was encouraged to contact them to set up a Pymt Plan ASAP. Includes 15CM559, 18CF383.  jaf

From DE on 4-30-19 stating he can't make pymt until Fri.  Ret'd call to DE today & left a v/m stating I will approve for his pymt to be pd by 4 pm on 5-03-19, but going fwd, his pymts are due on or before his due date of the 29th as he picked this due date.  DE was also advised that if his paydays do not fall on the 29th of ea mo, he must make arrangements & pay his pymts on or before the 29th for all future pymts. Includes 15CM559, 18CF383.  jaf

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Rohan, ADA:  Megan E. Kelly   DF ATTY:  Daniel P Repka   DF:  Michael Antoine Payne appeared. Cases called at 9:11 am. Includes: 15CM495, 15CM559, 15CM730, 15CT165, 15CT265 and 14CT181. ADA Kelly recites agreement. Court questions DEF regarding rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G  to Cts  1 and 2 in 15CM559. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Court reads police reports. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Cts 1 and 2 in 15CM559. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Cts 1 and 2 in 15CM495, Cts 3 and 4 in 15CM559 and Cts 1-5 in 15CM730 and 15CT165, 15CT265, 14CT181. Sentencing arguments. DEF addresses Court. Crt orders:
15CM559 - Ct 1 - W/H, 1 year probation with conditions:
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.  
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment.
- Court costs $243
- DNA surcharge $200
- Report to probation 6/13/16
Court Orders in 15CM559 - Ct 2 - Sentenced to 30 days St. Croix County Jail, credit for 30 days time served
- Court costs $243
- DNA surcharge $200  
-Bonds remain in effect until DEF reports to probation
- Apply bond on file
Court explains right to appeal.
Adjourned 9:27 am
Decision and Order signed by EJL 6/13/16 - Defendant's Motion to Suppress are DENIED. eif
for continuance of  6/9/16 PTC filed by Atty Repka.    Per SRN 6/9/16 - keep PTC date as is. eif

Attorneys working on a global resolution and would like to set all files out for a PTC/Possible plea for after the 06/09/16 date.  State has received a letter from the victim in file 15CM730 asking the No Contact be lifted. Current: 551 Monette Ave #15, New Richmond, WI 54017 United States  (Effective: 03-17-2016)
Prior: 355 N 4th St, New Richmond, WI 54017 
per Defendant. eif
to Suppress and Dismiss filed by Atty Repka. eif

*AMENDED* 
Includes case 15CM495, 15CM559, 15CM730, 15CT265, 14CT165 & 14CT181

-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- DE not to drive a motorized vehicle until obtaining a valid driver's license

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Lowry Hotel in New Richmond or Gregory B.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
